headline: Easy Slow Cooker Meatballs
description: This crockpot meatballs recipe is quick and easy to prep… Let your slow cooker do all the work for a comforting hot meal at the end of the day!

video.description: See how to make amazing meatballs in the slow cooker.
video.name: Easy Slow Cooker Meatballs

name: Easy Slow Cooker Meatballs

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef, bread crumbs, onion, garlic, parsley, and egg in a large bowl; mix well until evenly combined, then shape into 16 meatballs.
Pour spaghetti sauce and crushed tomatoes into the slow cooker; stir in tomato purée. Place the meatballs into the sauce mixture.
Cover and cook on Low for 6 to 8 hours.

review.reviewBody: It tasted fine. The meatballs were very moist from slow cooking all day, which I liked, but the downside is all the fat from the meat stays in the sauce, where when I bake them some of that drains away….so not very heart healthy. The recipe is definitely missing salt, in the sauce and the meatballs. The sauce was not to my taste, but my husband loved it. It was very runny which is not surprising since all the steam runs right back in while it cooks in a slow cooker so it does not thicken like on the stove. I added cornstarch in the end to thicken it up.
I used elk that I harvested, doubled the recipe and used bbq sauce instead of spaghetti sauce. It tasted great, elk was big gamey at all.

The meat balls need to be browned. Some salt needs to be added, maybe a pinch or two. Salt by its nature is a flavor enhancer. Suggest kosher or sea salt. A teaspoon or two of Italian seasoning should be added. Also a teaspoon of sugar added to the sauce to cut the acid of the tomatoes. Also suggest some parmigiana cheese, grated, to add flavor to the sauce. Increase the amount of garlic. Just my opinion.
I loved the recipe. it was easy!
No where does the recipe call for salt but the meatballs desperately need salt. Otherwise, the recipe is very easy. I will be making again but with one added ingredient--salt!
The meatballs were delicious but the sauce wasn't great. Everything tasted better after sitting a day in the fridge, oddly enough. I used turkey instead of beef.
It tasted like tomato sauce poured over meatballs. I had to get an anti acid to calm my stomach!!
These meatballs taste just like my mothers. Everybody loves these.
me my boyfriend and our daughter love this, definitely one of our favorites

My very first time making meatballs, I did add Parmesan to the mix. I will make these again. Instead of the purée and the tomatoes, I used 2 jars of marinara sauce instead. Next time I will add some Italian seasoning, but in the all in all, came out great.
I used frozen meatballs. Found the sauce a bit bland. Would add garlic and some Italian spice and sweet peppers maybe.

This is a very good meatball recipes! I did use half lean ground turkey and precook the meatballs for 20 min at 375. Because we like spicy foods, I almost doubled the spices but not the salt. Thank you for this delicious recipe served with pasta and Parmesan cheese.

Not sure how this got so many stars when almost all the commenters said they changed the recipe( wouldn’t that mean the recipe isn’t that good) ... anyway I’m giving it 3 stars because it was edible. The meatballs lacked flavor and consistency. I would not make these again.

Awesome! I made it in my slow cooker for 8 hours and was amazing at how good it came out. The sauce didn't change much in flavor for a really long time but after it crossed the 8 hour mark the flavor got a lot deeper and meatier. I will use this recipe on repeat for dinner at the end of the day. The only change I made to the recipe was that I used half italian sausage and half ground beef instead of all ground beef. And i definitely wouldnt take it out before 8 hours

These meatballs are absolutely delicious. I cut back a little on the bread crumbs and added some parmesan and Rao's marinara sauce. 
Best meatballs I ever made.

delicious and easy to make! you may want to brown the meatballs before putting them in the crock pot to remove some of the fat or buy a very lean meat so the sauce will have a lot of grease sitting on top. This will be a fun recipe to try some different spices in the meatballs.
The flavor was good, but in the end, I have meaty sauce, hardly any meat balls. Next time I will try baking the meatballs a little first before putting them in the slow cooker
nasty. taste like a very bad meatloaf sandwich. would absolutely never make again
My whole family enjoy the meatballs and the sauce. I was so easy to make

made this several times now - add extra spices to sauce - garlic, basil, oregano, parsley. Find it a little bland without. 
 I also add 1/2 cup breadcrumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese to 2 lbs hamburger meat with a little garlic and onion powder and 2 eggs. We really enjoy it over pasta or as subs.
I forgot the spaghetti sauce on the first try so I just added a touch of sugar. Also used a mix of light and dark ground turkey . Amazing!
Awesome and so very easy to do. However time was of the essence, so I cooked them on the stovetop in a large pot for an hour and a half. Definitely will be a family favorite.

This recipe is not very flavorful. It's missing something, but I'm no chef so I don't know what, maybe just salt. The taste was bland and texture of the meatballs was mushy, they didn't maintain their structure. It was edible, but I won't make it again. It seems like these are a good start for someone with culinary talents to expand on.

My family loved these, however they were so tender that they were falling apart, which is not necessarily a bad thing, I just wanted them to stay together better. I made my own sauce so I can't comment on that part of the recipe.

Excellent recipe! We doubled the recipe and added parmesan cheese to the meatball mixture. Definitely bake the meatballs in the oven at 350 for 15 - 18 minutes. We added an additional 2 jars of spaghetti sauce. I cooked on low for about 8 hours. Everyone loved the recipe! Definitely will make again! A keeper.
Just perfect for me with enough to freeze. I have already made it three times.

So salt or seasoning?!? My son didn’t like them they were bland and I even added cheese to the meat:( Good concept for easy slow cooker meal and yes you can salt your plate but I don’t think it would hurt to add at preparation of recipe.

Unbelievable! The sauce was so savory that I could have eaten that alone. I followed directions to a t, which I usually don’t do, but I’m so glad I did. I used Hunts canned garlic and herb spaghetti sauce.
Easy to cook - quite tasty!!!

Disappointed. Had to alter the recipe. The meat balls would not stay together. Added another egg and water. Helped a little. 
I think the recipe calls for too much bread crumbs.
Had a onion flavor which I like.
I loved this recipe! I added the cheese and I used regular bread crumbs.I like a lot of sauce so I used 2 jars instead of 1& Larger size of pure and crushed tomatoes! Also 2lbs .of ground beef.

Was easy and tasty. I got a late start, so I cooked them in a large pan on top of the stove. Cooked them at medium simmer, gently turning for about an hour. Add Al dente penne pasta , added to the meatballs and sauce.
It came out delicious

this was an easy recipe to follow & came out pretty yummy. I would suggest instead of baking the balls @ 375 for 15min, put them into a deep skillet and brown all sides of them before transferring them to the slow cooker. also, I added some fresh white mushrooms and some garbanzo beans to the pot cuz the sauce I used was ragu traditional .it came out great! I served it with rigatoni pasta

This was awesome. The only changes I made were ones of convenience or necessity. I had 2 pounds of ground beef and didn't feel like dealing with fresh parsley or garlic so I used dried. I used the recommended amount of bread crumbs plus a bit more. I followed another reviewers suggestion for freezing them and throwing them in the crock frozen since I was going to cooking them longer than the recommended time. I didn't have the tomato puree but did have a little extra spaghetti sauce. I did season my sauce with garlic powder and Italian seasoning and found the sauce very flavorful. Will definitely make these again.

Good - but I needed to make some changes: I added garlic powder, basil, pepper, and 1/2 c. Parmesan to the meatballs, I reduced the bread crumbs to 1/2 c., and I put the onion in the sauce and cut them in large chunks. For the sauce, I removed the tomato puree, added 2 minced garlic cloves, basil, oregano and 2 T. sugar. I made them into about 30 meatballs, baked for 15 minutes at 350F to cut the fat, and refrigerated until the next morning, removing any remaining fat. My slow cooker runs hot, so these probably would have been done in 4-6 hours. The nutrition facts are deceiving since they're based one one meatball. Who eats one meatball? Not me! :-)
Made them with pork instead of beef - absolutely delicious!

It came out really good! I’ll definitely make it again. I added a little sugar as I like my sauce a little sweeter . I might add tomato paste next time to make it a little thicker. But definitely a keeper!

I will certainly make it again. Fast & easy. Like the other reviews, I put the meatballs in the oven for 20 min.at 350. I also added salt and pepper and spices to the mix for extra flavor. Very good. Doubled the recipe and froze a batch for unexpected company.
Oh my gosh.... these meatballs were delicious. I’ve never heard of soaking the bread in milk to make these super yummy & moist. Hubby & I really liked these. Highly recommend this recipe.

I am surprised that I actually made such delicious meatballs. This is the first time in my life where I am actually satisfied with the taste of "homemade meatballs." This is an excellent recipe! I will use again and again.
Awesome doing this again asap

1/2 LB. ground pork..
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 1/2 cups flavored bread crumbs
Was a little too salty otherwise total perfection
I followed this recipe to the letter always comes out very good...
I agree with others, sauce is bland to my taste. I add bulk Sweet Ita!Ian sausage to meat balls.

Made a couple of changes. I added grated cheese to the meatballs and used 2 eggs because I used more hamburger. I didn’t have tomato purée, so I used some beef broth instead. I used spicy tomato sauce. I followed the recipe as written. I cooked it on low even longer than I should have because I was out and didn’t get home in time. The results were excellent. They were some of the best meatballs and sauce I ever made. I am Italian, so I have made plenty. I will definitely be making this again.
Fabulous! I used 1 lb ground beef mixed with 1 lb ground turkey. Best meatballs ever. So yummy over rice.

These meatballs were really easy to make, except for the part of grating the onion. It took quite a while to do that and I finally gave up and just finally chopped the remaining onion. Are used a jar of high-quality spaghetti sauce (Organica Bella marinara) and a 28 ounce can of mashed tomatoes. That was more than enough sauce. It needed more seasoning so I added about a teaspoon of fennel seeds and at least one and a half tablespoons of oregano and some salt and pepper. Turned out great. The meatballs stayed together nicely with the amount of breadcrumbs the recipe called for. I probably would not have used that many breadcrumbs if I had made it up myself, but this amount is good. I would definitely make this again.
One of the recipes that my Granddaughter asked me to share!
Excellent receipe. I chopped up some green pepper and onion and added to meat balls....very good!
I liked the taste and it is not that difficult to make but I only had it in the slow cooker for 6 hours and the meatballs were falling apart. Anybody else have this problem?

All I would say is don't chop the onions (unless you just WANT to) - mince or grate them. The meatballs are much easier to manipulate and they hold together better. And I absolutely will be making them again!
I've made this a few times, and MAN... they are BEYOND EXCELLENT
No changes to the recipe, glad I did not. Do the fact it was fabulous very tasty. If I would have changed something, I would of not gotten to enjoy this most delicious meal.
Very easy to make and my boys love it
I made this in my instant pot in 30 minutes! it was so delicious and tasted like it cooked all day in the slow cooker! great recipe!
Needs a little more garlic
I had a meatloaf mix so I used that. Otherwise, I followed the recipe. My husband loved them. I made a 2nd batch and froze them.
I added a few extra ingredients to my sauce ( I like adding sugar) etc they came out amazing!!!!
This recipe lacked . . . I am not sure what. But it was too bland. My wife looked at me and said, "Please stick with the meat sauce, Honey."

I RXd this recipe and I agree with one of the reviewers about it being bland. I found both meatballs and sauce to be lacking in umami. I think I will add a bit of salt to the meatball mixture next time and brown them before adding into the slow cooker. I give it 3 stars because it was very easy to make.

My children loved it. I made an alternation to this recipe by baking meatballs in the oven at 350 for 15 minutes before adding them in the sauce. This helped meatballs become more dense and spongy. I will repeat this recipe.

I love meatballs especially the traditional italian style! I did add 1 t more ingredient & added 1 extra step. I add a little parmesan to the mixture, not alot since we add more before eating. I also broiled the meatballs for few minutes until brown prior to placing in slow cooker (I've also pan fried /seared etc.. but this takes longer) . I prefer the texture that the oven or pan frying gives you over the soft mushy texture from cooking straight from the Crock-Pot. I'm not a chef by a long shot but trying recipes here and there, tweaking a little or a lot it seems, this is the recipe we come back to. Thanks
Nice.
My very picky elementary aged dinner guest fully approved of this meal. It was a hit and now I keep stuff to make it on hand. It’s cooking in my crockpot right now and it’s all that I can smell.

I switched ground beef for ground turkey and replaced the parsley with italian seasoning(all I had on hand). I also added a little mozzarella & parmesan cheese. They came out fantastic! Will be making this again. :)
I made these using both ground pork and beef together and they were delicious.

I made this ultimately to take to my daughters cell group to feed all the girls for dinner one night, so I doubled the recipe so my family of 6 could eat off of the same meal and everyone LOVED it! My daughter said all the girls kept talking about how good it was :)

I make this ALL the time and it has become a family favorite. I have changed up the ingredients in the meatballs a bit and vary the flavor of the jarred sauce so that it doesn't taste exactly the same every time.
Serve it with different types of pasta and today serving it with ravioli. 
Easiest recipe ever and complete you cannot get it wrong!
Bon Apetit!

Delicious! I used whatever we had on hand! As far as ground meats I did 80/20 and ground turkey w/bacon and then halved the breadcrumbs! These meatballs were so tender ... and then with using whatever jarred canned and liquid tomato products I had ... thee best sauce!! Plus I threw in an eggplant and parmesan rind for goodness measure! Thank you chef!
Wonderful meatballs, I tweaked the recipe slightly added two eggs and additional sauce. Over all the meatballs were great, it made enough for dinner and meatball sandwiches the next day!
Doubled the recipe and took it to a church lunch. Nothing but sauce to bring home.

These meatballs turned out great! Even those more particular dinner guests enjoyed them. I did not make any changes to the recipe other than crafting "Italian" breadcrumbs by using Panko breadcrumbs and salt, garlic salt, pepper, basil, and oregano. I used ground sirloin 90/10. Made an extra 1/2 recipe and cooked for 7 hours. This maxed out my 6 qt crockpot - although could swap more meatballs for sauce, unless you want sauce for pasta. Will definitely make again!

I bought a lb of ground beef. Then, decided I'd like slow cooker meatballs and searched the site. I read comments and decided to saute onions, green pepper, and garlic plus add seasonings. Then, I decided that it wouldn't be good to add hot vegetables to the jeat mixture as it would cook the egg. I soaked the bread crumbs in some milk. I added raw onions, formed the mixture into balls, and browned in the sauce pan along with the vegetables. I didn't want to put raw meat into the sauce. The sauce is leftover jarred spaghetti sauce and an 8 oz can if diced tomatoes plus seasoning. To that I added the meatballs and sauteed vegetables. It says cook six to eight hours. As mine were partially cooked and looked done, I cooked for 3.5 hrs, I think. In any case, they were thoroughly cooked. I never have any luck with meatballs. I'll call these a success and will make them again. It's nice to cook sans oven and without watching meatballs overcook in a fry pan. I didn't make pasta but served with good bakery bread. We're it for a family, idcook spaghetti and shave parmesan cheese on top. Maybe, I'd add fresh, sauteed mushrooms and more green pepper. I spiced with chili flakes as reviewers complained of a bland sauce.
Loved it, I used this recipe but used 1/3 ground beef, 1/3 ground spicy italian sausage and 1/3 ground turkey. Plus added mushrooms, peppers and spinach.

I made a couple of changes based on what I had available. I used ground turkey instead of the beef, Pankos bread crumbs and Mediterranean seasoning since I didn’t have Italian breadcrumbs and dried parsley since I didn’t have fresh. I grilled some onions and bell peppers and made a meatball sandwich on a Kaiser roll topped with the onions and bell peppers. Amazing!!!!!
These tasted good but I've had better. They were rather crumbly when it came time to eat.

change +he amoun+ of bread crumbs +o 3/4 of a cup
no jar sauce.....use 1 can of I+alian +oma+os, and puree +hem and add 1 +sp. I+alian herbs +o +he sauce

Used extra lean ground beef, reduces the fat in the crock pot. Meatballs kept their shape after cooking for 9 hours on low. Only used 1 cup of bread crumbs but will try with 1/2 cup crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan cheese next time. Put the meatballs together the night before, covered & put in refrigerator and quickly put it together in the crockpot next morning. Served over rice.

I was quite pleased with this recipe. It combined the ease of using canned sauces with the homemade touch of the meatballs! I used ground turkey for mine and I cut the bread crumbs down to 1/4 cup. I also added generous amounts of garlic powder, salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, basil, oregano, and onion powder to the sauce. I just kept tasting it until it seemed flavorful. I left out the tomato puree (didn't have any). I will certainly make this again!
Have to add pork and or veal with the beef, I also add milk to keep them moist

Delicious! I did add some salt, pepper and a little Parmesan cheese to the meatball mixture and also added in some garlic powder, salt, pepper, oregano and sugar to the sauce to jazz it up a bit. Really couldn't be easier to make, and it was nice to have this ready to go at dinnertime. I made smaller meatballs, so I cooked them less time, obviously. This recipe is nice because you can season the sauce and meatballs any way you like and just use this recipe as a guide for cooking them in the slow cooker, which is great and something that I would've never thought to do! I will def be making these again~YUM!!!!! Thanks for sharing. :)

These are probably the best meatballs I've had in awhile. I can't stand the frozen store bought meatballs and some other recipes for homemade just don't have any flavor. However, this recipe is packed with flavor. I made a batch for the crockpot and a batch that I just baked in the oven with no sauce (my son isn't big on sauce!). Both batches came out fantastic!
These were delicious! I crushed the garlic rather than mincing.
Delicious. I used extra lean beef and they turned out wonderfully.
Simple and easy to make recipe. Will definitely make this again. I made this for Christmas Eve dinner. Everyone enjoyed it. I wish I would have taken a picture of it.

I am eating these as we speak and they are SUPER delicious. Like many other reviewers, I did make a few edits to the original recipe:

1. I added salt, black pepper, dried oregano, and red pepper flakes to the meat mixture
2. I used only 1 cup of breadcrumbs
3. I baked the meatballs at 350 for 15min the night before in order to cook off some of the fat and also brown the meat
4. I added salt, pepper, dried garlic, and red wine to the tomato puree/crushed tomato mix
5. I used a good jar of sauce... we like Newman's Own Sockarooni.

We cooked them in our instant pot for 6.5 hours on medium. Delicious!
My first one, everyone said it was good. I liked it too. Will make it again.

I used ground flax seed instead of the bread crumbs, used 1 cup versus the 1.5 recommended. It is a great way to get extra fibre in. I also changed the sauce from 680ml spaghetti sauce and 796ml diced tomatoes, it's what I had on hand. I added Italian spices to the sauce after reading the other comments. Served it over spaghetti squash. Yum yum

I made mine with home canned spaghetti sauce and home canned tomato sauce. Added a can of tomato paste to thicken the sauce. Loved the nice soft meatballs. I love having a recipe that does not call for browning them. I left out the onion and added adobo seasoning, paprika and just a pinch of cilantro along with the thyme, basil, parsley and oregano. So delicious. Next time I'm going to try half ground beef and half italian sausage. Yum!
I loved these. They were really flavorful and very easy to make. They definitely needed the full 8 hours of cook time, though.

My husband and I loved these meat balls. I used just 1 cup of bread crumbs and followed all other directions. We will make again. For the leftovers we put the noodles in the pot with the sauce and meatballs and put it on warm. For 2 it was dinner then lunch the next day. Great for our weekends!

For less fat use ground turkey or chicken (93/7) ratio.
I also added milk (1/4 cup) and parmesan (1/2 cup). I'll even give you my secret spice...1 TBS paprika. Much less greasy sauce than with beef and just as tasty.

Amazing!!! Saved me sooooo much time. I used what I had on hand. Used diced tomatoes instead of crushed, used oats instead of breadcrumbs and added Parmesan to the meat also. The sauce can be bland so add your Italian seasonings!! Load up on all the flavors that you love!! I used and Italian seasoning blend and used a bunch of dried sweet basil and a ton of garlic powder and added 2 tablespoons sugar oh and a dash or 2 of salt. I cooked on high for 3 hours. I was in a time crunch and they came out perfect!!! My picky boys are it all up!!

I followed other suggestions and added only one cup of breadcrumbs. I used 3 garlic cloves and 1 t of Parmesan, but It needs more Parmesan and basil. For the sauce, I like the suggestion of adding basil, oregano and 2 T sugar to add a llittle sweetness. I think the sauce will be fine without the purée. It certainly makes plenty of sauce.

I actually made these in the pressure cooker which only took 15-20 minutes. 
They are good but this is waaaay too much onion. Cut in half.

This was simple to make & very tasty; my husband loved the meatballs & sauce! The next time I make it, I do think I will add salt, parmesan cheese & some red pepper flakes to the meatballs to give them a little more flavor. Some people may find them to be a little too bland by themselves. Slow cooking in the sauce & tomato mixture all day does help to give them their flavor. All in all, a solid recipe & I will definitely make again.

I need gluten free, so I crumbled up some toasted gluten free dense bread from Food For Life instead of breadcrumbs. I added about a Tablespoon of Italian Seasoning to the mixture, since I wasn't using seasoned breadcrumbs. Didn't use cheese at all. I followed up by baking them, which was great. When I added them to my crockpot, I used only pasta sauce. Roasted Garlic from Organics. Then I added some dried Oregano and dried Basil to the sauce to balance it out. Finally, I added a splash of red wine. For noodles, I use Spaghetti Squash. Delicious meal!!!
